The claim made in the Republican attack: Senate candidate in Nevada, of putting "deadly drunk drivers back on the roads."
The ad: s narrator states that "Catherine Cortez Masto's office" approved the "early release" of drunk drivers from prison when she was the state's attorney general.
The Reno Gazette: Journal reported that at least 40 of the 113 people convicted of killing or severely injuring someone while driving drunk in Nevada since 2000 were released early. These drivers were allowed to serve the remainder of their terms under house arrest instead of behind bars.
Cortez Masto: s role was to quickly reverse the early-release policy and order as many drivers back to prison as she could, stating that her office had misinterpreted the law.
